election_record.label: Pennsylvania 1801 Mayor, Philadelphia City

overview.note: "Election of Mayor. In select and Common Council yesterday, a letter was received from Jonathan B. Smith, Mayor elect, intimating his determination to decline the acceptance of the honor conferred upon him -- upon which the councils proceeded vive voce, to the choice of mayor." American. And Daily Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). October 29, 1801.

"Upon calling the vote, there appeared for Matthew Lawler, 23 -- for John Clement Stocker, 8 votes. So that the former is duly elected Mayor of the city." The True American and Commercial Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). October 27, 1801.
